attributes.action: Consider tax cuts to help the homeless
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
What has tax cuts to do with the homeless? – It could trigger the release of homes for the homeless – such as:

1)	A zero rate tax rate to all lettings to the homeless of  the unsold units currently held by builders.  An additional incentive is to pay perhaps 80% of the market price in deferred instalments say annually over 3-5 years?. The management of these units can be done by the council or social landlords for a fixed fee?
2)	Similarly, a zero rate tax rate for all privately owned lets to the homeless.
3)	Do also consider converting all those unsold shared ownership units held by housing associations to general needs  and please do not “claw back” the VAT recovery made on the taxable status of shared ownership units. 
4)	Please have a zero rate tax for the not for profit community run companies.
5)	Community centres should be encouraged on all estates with more than 20 units and VAT zero rated status on all these facilities.

Do increase the higher rate tax band to 50% to fund the tax cuts. 

Please spare a thought for the homeless as you have the power to make a difference.
